entry.title: Error: While connecting from SAP BTP Integration Suite to SAP S4 Cloud Odata
entry.content:
Hello Team,

 

I'm getting below error while connecting from SAP BTP Integration Suite Cloud to SAP S4 Cloud Odata service.

"com.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: HTTP Request failed with error : <HOST>: No address associated with hostname, cause: java.net.UnknownHostException: <HOST>: No address associated with hostname"

 

 

 

Thanks and Regards,

Rajesh PS

entry.title: Does enabling the Integration Runtime service and creating an OAuth client for API usage in Integrat
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,
I am using Integration Suite under a TDD (Test & Development) license.
To call APIs, I need to enable the Integration Runtime service and create an OAuth client.
If I create and actually use these APIs, will there be any additional charges beyond the Integration Suite entitlement?
Also, in the Discovery Center, I can find Integration Suite, but when I search for Integration Runtime service, it does not appear. Is this expected?
(Reference: Discovery Center search link　https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/servicessearch/Integration)

Attached is a screenshot from the Subaccount → Add Service Plans screen, where I see SAP Process Integration Runtime with plans like api and integration-flow.
Any clarification on licensing and cost implications would be greatly appreciated.
Thank you!

entry.title: "Create an Account on the Gateway Demo System" no longer working
entry.content:
I was doing the tutorial https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/hcp-apim-create-provider.html

In the tutorial we need a demo user on the ES5 System.

In the turial is a link that is titled "Create an Account on the Gateway Demo System" but unfortunately the meanied tutorial say Es% demo server is decomission and therefore one can not create a demo user, but the tutorial mentioned other ways to get demoe users.

So I came to the tutorial:

https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/abap-environment-trial-onboarding.html

But here I do not see where / when / how I would ceate a user doing the stept of the turial. So what am I missing?

 

 

And does anybody has an idea how to finish the tutorial https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/hcp-apim-create-provider.html without creating a demo user on ES5?

 

Kind regards

 Patrick

entry.title: Cloud connector REST call
entry.content:
HI, We have a SAP Cloud base system. We also have an in-house Document Management system.

If in house we use a rest call to get a document from the DMS we get the document back, if we try from cloud it fails as the DMS doesn't have a "public" facing IP address, so we mapped the in-house system to the cloud SAP solution using the Cloud Integration, so our server address inside the cloud configuration shows as CLOUDDMS (virtual hostname), plus port and our server actual name and address. but now the question is how do we point our current rest call, that just to be something like DMS:9777/web/v1/document/token to call the virtual host, will it be something as simple as change DMS for CLOUDDMS, and send the rest of our build the same, or do we have to re-code our full call into Cloud connector???

 

Thank you.

entry.title: Alert Retry Mechanism
entry.content: Im having a scenario where I will send data to target via mail so that if any error occurs in the iflow it should retry that error. When the error is resolved in the iflow it should automatically stop the retry and process and it needs to send data to the target via mail.

entry.title: How Can I Design a Scalable, Secure, and Cost-Optimized Architecture Using Microsoft Azure Services
entry.content:
I’m currently working on modernizing our organization’s IT infrastructure and evaluating how we can fully leverage Microsoft Azure Services to build a scalable, secure, and cost-efficient cloud environment. Since our business is rapidly growing and we plan to migrate multiple legacy applications, databases, analytics workloads, and internal services to the cloud, I’m looking for guidance on the best architectural approach and which Azure services we should prioritize.

1. How Should I Choose the Right Azure Compute Services?

  • What decision framework should I follow to select the best compute option for microservices, web apps, APIs, or batch processing workloads?

2. Looking for Real-World Guidance

If anyone has designed or implemented a full-scale enterprise architecture on Azure:

  • What were your biggest challenges and lessons learned?
  • What services did you prioritize, and what pitfalls should I avoid?
  • Any reference architectures or step-by-step practices would be extremely helpful.
  • Are there recommended patterns for mixing serverless and container-based workloads?

entry.title: Infrastructure as Code on APIM through the SDK
entry.content:
We are building an API portal on SAP Integration Suite exposing api's from SAP Commerce Cloud for a large global client.

To do this we need to configure provider, proxies, policies, certificates, endpoints, api products etc. on SAP APIM.

We are using 4 BTP instances/environments for this: CI, Dev, QA and Prod.

Since we don't want to manually set up all these resources on each environment, we are building a custom IaC setup, which can configure all these resources automatically from GitHub actions.

Our IaC setup uses the SDK's provided for BTP and APIM to configures the instances. Not an easy task, since the SDK's are very poorly documented by SAP.

Part of the setup is to have GitHub actions run on pull requests to configure an entire resource setup needed for running automated api tests against the API products defined on APIM.

All of the above seems like standard features which SAP should provide for BTP and APIM through something like a terraform provider.

Is anybody else working on something like this?

API Management

entry.title: SPF Failure When Sending Emails from BTP BPA and Integration Suite
entry.content:
I am encountering the following SPF failures when SAP BTP Build Process Automation and Integration Suite attempt to send emails using the rmsinc.com domain:

  • Fail (protection.outlook.com: domain of rmsinc.com does not designate 54.162.233.194 as a permitted sender)

  • Fail (protection.outlook.com: domain of rmsinc.com does not designate 52.23.123.125 as a permitted sender)

It appears that these IP addresses are not included in the current SPF record of rmsinc.com.

Question:
Where can I find the complete list of IP addresses that must be added to the rmsinc.com SPF record to allow outgoing emails from SAP BTP (BPA and Integration Suite)?

Thank you in advanc

entry.title: SAP Integration suite SFTP Sender adapter archiving function is not working - Submitted to SAP
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

 We are using an SFTP sender to pick up files from the server and then move them to an archive folder. Currently, the file pickup is working fine, but the files are not being moved to the archive folder. Because of this, the same file is getting processed multiple times. I have checked the folder permissions, and all folders have read, write, and execute access. I am attaching a screenshot of the SFTP configuration.

entry.title: Integration Suite Event Mesh - Management API
entry.content:
Hi Gurus,

I have noticed that Integration Suite Event Mesh is now offering an API that was previously only available for Standalone Event Mesh: the EM Management API.

Standalone EM APIs

https://api.sap.com/package/SAPEventMeshDefaultPlan/rest

This API is leveraged by SAP CALM for health monitoring of the Integration Suite broker.

Unfortunately, SAP has kept the details to themselves, and the API Business Hub does not show the new API for Integration Suite.

Integration Suite Event Mesh API

https://api.sap.com/package/EventMeshinSAPIntegrationSuite/rest

In the API Business Hub, there are no details about the Management API being leveraged by SAP CALM, but we know it is there.

We have not been able to determine the BasePath for this API yet, as it has changed compared to the Standalone version (https://XXX:YYYY/hub/rest/api/v1/management/...).

Has anyone found the BasePath for this API?

Best regards,
Mikel

entry.title: Assessing the number of messages in SAP integration Suite
entry.content:
Most of the developers overlook that the billing of iflows is based on the number of messages rather than the iflow design object or number of Users. 

While designing an iflow a judicious choice of Multicast has to be taken into account. 

The moment the multicast is used, it will split a message into a copy of a message and increase the count of messages created in the iflow. 

Also. While creating a solution for successfactors, one optimization can be using AEM brokered rather than point to point SF querying interfaces.

entry.content:

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Persistent Deployment Error: "No artifact descriptor found" on Trial Account
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I have done all possible solutions to run my iFlow successfully, but I am facing a persistent deployment error.

Despite receiving the message "Artifact Deployed Successfully," the iFlow fails immediately. The error log shows:
java.lang.IllegalStateException: No artifact descriptor found for artifactName OpenData

I have already tried the following troubleshooting steps multiple times without success:
1. Undeploying the artifact, waiting for it to be fully removed, and then redeploying.
2. Saving the iFlow as a new version and deploying the new version.
3. Copying the artifact to a new iFlow and deploying the copy.

The exact same error occurs every time. I am on a trial account in the US10 region
(cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com), and I believe this might be a platform-level error.

Any suggestion or solution is highly appreciated.

entry.title: Odata v4 batch request error
entry.content:
Hi Community!

I am using the HTTP adapter to send a batch request to S/4HANA.
Using the same request, it succeeds when executed manually on postman, but when triggered from the iFlow, the request fails with an error.
I would like to understand why this issue occurs.
Request Body:

--batch
Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary=changeset_1

--changeset_1
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary
Content-ID: 1

POST ServiceContractItem/7000004039/100/_Partner HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
   "CustMgmtPartnerFunction": "Z0000001",
   "CustMgmtBusinessPartner": "E0224413"
}

--changeset_1
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary
Content-ID: 2

POST ServiceContractItem/7000004039/200/_Partner HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
   "CustMgmtPartnerFunction": "Z0000001",
   "CustMgmtBusinessPartner": "E0285537"
}

--changeset_1
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary
Content-ID: 3

POST ServiceContractItem/7000004039/300/_Partner HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
   "CustMgmtPartnerFunction": "Z0000001",
   "CustMgmtBusinessPartner": "B8785850"
}

--changeset_1--
--batch--

Response:

--B28488A2BD5F4D0D551E37FBDFE400600
Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary=B28488A2BD5F4D0D551E37FBDFE400601
Content-Length:        10657

--B28488A2BD5F4D0D551E37FBDFE400601
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Length: 977
content-transfer-encoding: binary
content-id: 1

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
Content-Type: application/json;odata.metadata=minimal;charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 339
location: ../SrvcContrItemPartner(ServiceContract='7000004039',ServiceContractItem='100',CustMgmtPartnerFunction='Z0000001',CustMgmtBusinessPartner='E0224413')
odata-version: 4.0
cache-control: no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate
sap-messages: [{"code":"COM_PARTNER/120","message":"Too many Delivery To Party entered; remove 6","numericSeverity":4},{"code":"CRMS4_ORDER_RAP/001","message":"Object 7000004039 is saved","numericSeverity":1},{"code":"CRMS4_ORDER_RAP/001","message":"Object  is saved","numericSeverity":1}]

{"@odata.context":"../../../$metadata#SrvcContrItemPartner/$entity","@odata.metadataEtag":"W/\"20251213085401\"","ServiceContract":"7000004039","ServiceContractItem":"100","CustMgmtPartnerFunction":"Z0000001","CustMgmtBusinessPartner":"E0224413","CustMgmtPartFunctionCategory":"0000","CustMgmtPartnerIsMainPartner":true,"SAP__Messages":[]}
--B28488A2BD5F4D0D551E37FBDFE400601
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Length: 853
content-transfer-encoding: binary
content-id: 2

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
Content-Type: application/json;odata.metadata=minimal;charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 340
location: ../SrvcContrItemPartner(ServiceContract='7000004039',ServiceContractItem='100',CustMgmtPartnerFunction='Z0000001',CustMgmtBusinessPartner='E0285537')
odata-version: 4.0
cache-control: no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate
sap-messages: [{"code":"COM_PARTNER/127","message":"Address of partner E0285537 (Delivery To Party) does not have an address type","numericSeverity":3,"target":""}]

{"@odata.context":"../../../$metadata#SrvcContrItemPartner/$entity","@odata.metadataEtag":"W/\"20251213085401\"","ServiceContract":"7000004039","ServiceContractItem":"100","CustMgmtPartnerFunction":"Z0000001","CustMgmtBusinessPartner":"E0285537","CustMgmtPartFunctionCategory":"0000","CustMgmtPartnerIsMainPartner":false,"SAP__Messages":[]}
--B28488A2BD5F4D0D551E37FBDFE400601
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Length: 853
content-transfer-encoding: binary
content-id: 3

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
Content-Type: application/json;odata.metadata=minimal;charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 340
location: ../SrvcContrItemPartner(ServiceContract='7000004039',ServiceContractItem='100',CustMgmtPartnerFunction='Z0000001',CustMgmtBusinessPartner='B8785850')
odata-version: 4.0
cache-control: no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate
sap-messages: [{"code":"COM_PARTNER/127","message":"Address of partner B8785850 (Delivery To Party) does not have an address type","numericSeverity":3,"target":""}]

 

From the response, I don’t understand why the location of the second and third requests is returned as item 100, even though the requests were sent for items 200 and 300.

I’m wondering whether there is an issue with the request body.

Ramu.

entry.title: POST Request Working in Postman but Failing in CPI With CSRF Token Invalid — Need Help
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I’m working on an integration where I need to perform a POST call to an SAP OData V4 service using CSRF token protection.
 
The strange part is:

✅ The entire sequence (Fetch Token → Use Token → POST) works perfectly in Postman

But…

❌ The same sequence fails inside SAP CPI

even though CPI is sending the same headers.

I will attach the Postman screenshots here:

Below you can see the full end to end process of integration flow :

 

I am facing a persistent CSRF token validation issue while implementing a POST service call from SAP CPI (Cloud Integration). Even though I am successfully fetching the CSRF token via a GET request, the subsequent POST request returns the following error:
{
  "error": {
    "code": "/IWBEP/CM_V4H_RUN/042",
    "message": "CSRF token is invalid",
    "@SAP__common.ExceptionCategory": "CSRF_Token_Missing"
  }
}

 

End-to-End Scenario

Step 1 — Postman Calls CPI (HTTPS Adapter)

Postman sends a request to CPI with the following header:

X-CSRF-Token: Fetch

This header is correctly received in CPI runtime.

I am sharing my complete flow and steps hoping someone can help me identify what I am missing.
 

Step 2 — Store Incoming Fetch Header in CPI

I use a Content Modifier immediately after the Start event to store the incoming header value.

Step 3 — Log All Incoming Headers (Groovy Script)

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message

Message processData(Message message) {
    
    StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder()
    def headers = message.getHeaders()
    def messageLog = messageLogFactory.getMessageLog(message)
    
    headers.each { key, value -> builder << "${key}=${value}\n" }
    messageLog.addAttachmentAsString("Incoming message headers", builder.toString(), "text/plain")
    
    return message

}
​

 

This helps ensure CPI receives the X-CSRF-Token: Fetch correctly.


Step 4 — Request-Reply (GET) to Fetch CSRF Token

I perform the GET request to SAP backend with:

X-CSRF-Token: Fetch

The GET successfully returns the CSRF token and cookies through response headers.

 

Step 5 — Store Response Headers in Another Content Modifier

I then store the CSRF token and cookies returned by the backend GET request.

Step 6 — Use Stored CSRF Token & Payload to post the data

In the final step, I invoke another Request-Reply (POST) where I pass:

X-CSRF-Token: <token from GET response>
Cookie: <cookies from GET response>

 

 


Issue: POST Request Fails With Invalid CSRF Token

Even though the GET request successfully returns a token, the POST request always fails with:

CSRF token is invalid

or

CSRF_Token_Missing

What I Have Verified

✔ GET request returns a valid CSRF token
✔ Cookies are returned in the GET response
✔ Token and cookies are saved in content modifier
✔ POST request is sending saved token & cookies
✔ Logging confirms the correct headers
✔ No special casing in payload
✔ OData V4 service is working fine in Postman

But still the POST fails.

My CPI i-Flow Structure

Below is the full i-Flow layout I am using:

CPI helper i-flow :

 

 

Request to the Community

Could you please help validate:

  1. Whether my approach of storing token/cookie in content modifiers is correct?
  2. Do I need to combine multiple Set-Cookie headers into a single Cookie header manually?
  3. Are there any OData V4 specific restrictions for CSRF in SAP systems?
  4. Should token & cookie be stored using message properties instead of headers?
  5. Do I need a script to explicitly forward all backend cookies?
  6. Is there any known issue where CPI drops certain cookie attributes (Secure, Http Only, Path)?

Any guidance, correction, or recommended best practice would be extremely helpful.

entry.title: SAP Event Mesh
entry.content:
I am having an SAP Trail Account I want to access the SAP Event Mesh and create a small task, which will help me understand how the event mesh actually works, but I don't think trail accounts have the Event Mesh capability right?

I think event mesh was included in the trail account until last year or so, but right now I don't think trail accounts include event mesh service anymore right?

Please help me clarify this doubt, if I can access SAP's event mesh service on trail accounts or not
